mdRecord.dcterms:title: Villa Albicini, interior
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Hentz, Reid & Adler (American architectural firm, 20th century) [work]

mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Villa Albicini, the small-scaled residence villa designed in the late 1920's by the Atlanta architectural firm of Hentz, Reid & Adler is an example of the revived Italian Baroque style. Built from plans dated August 22, 1922, for a local nurseryman, D. C. Horgan, Villa Albicini (originally called the Horgan House) remains virtually unaltered from its original design as a synthesis of an Italian Baroque chapel, an Italian villa and the American elements of a curved double entrance stairway and the low height of the basement. -- http://focus.nps.gov/pdfhost/docs/NRHP/Text/74000661.pdf [work]
